form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Ricketts (for himself, Mr. Marshall, Mrs. Fischer, and Mr. Cornyn) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

form.official-title: Expressing support for the designation of May 2025 as National Beef Month to recognize the important role cattle play in the United States, and to consumers.

whereas.text: Whereas cattle production accounts for largest share of cash receipts for agricultural commodities in the United States at $88,400,000,000;
Whereas the United States produces the most beef in the world, accounting for 19 percent of global production;
Whereas the United States raises more than 92,000,000 head of cattle accounting for 6 percent of global production;
Whereas the United States has the largest inventory of fed cattle in the world;
Whereas beef provides 25 grams of high-quality protein per 3-ounce serving; and
Whereas beef contains essential nutrients which help the body convert food into energy and support immune health and brain function, including—

paragraph.text: iron, which helps with oxygen absorption;
choline, which supports nervous system development;
vitamins B6 and B12, which maintains brain function;
phosphorous, which builds bones and teeth;
zinc, which maintains immune system function;
niacin, which supports energy production and metabolism;
riboflavin, which converts food into energy; and
selenium, which promotes cell health: Now, therefore, be it
supports the designation of May 2025 as National Beef Month; and

subparagraph.text: historically, cattle production has contributed about 17 percent of the $520,000,000,000 in total cash receipts for agricultural commodities;
the United States is also the largest consumer of beef in the world, primarily high-value, grain-fed beef; and
beef is an excellent source of nutritious protein.
